alert.note: Alert for Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 4:53PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN RICHMOND... WESTMORELAND AND NORTHWESTERN ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EST... At 453 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms over Loretto, or over Champlain, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Newland and Leedstown around 500 PM EST. Montross around 505 PM EST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Lerty, Currioman Landing, Hustle, Potomac Beach, Oak Grove, Supply, Singerly, Mount Holly, Peeds, and Foneswood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for east central Virginia.
